clinical_study.brief_title: Noninvasive Positive Airway Pressure Ventilation and Risk of Facial Pressure Ulcers
clinical_study.official_title: Noninvasive Positive Airway Pressure Ventilation and Risk of Facial Pressure Ulcers in Patients With Acute Respiratory Failure

brief_summary.textblock: To assess risk of skin pressure lesions in patients treated with noninvasive mechanical ventilation.

detailed_description.textblock:
Noninvasive ventilation improves the outcome of patients with acute respiratory failure; however patient's discomfort may be responsible for up to a fifth of failures. Scant literature exists on NIV-related pressure ulcers and their determinants.
Aim of the study is to seek for determinants, if any, associated with the development of pressure ulcers related to noninvasive ventilation.
Study design: observational. Patients treated with NIV from December 2009 to December 2011 will be analyzed. Main end-points: to seek for variables associated to the development of NIV-related pressure ulcers in patients with acute respiratory failure.

primary_outcome.measure: Risk of skin pressure ulcers in patients treated with noninvasive ventilation for acute respiratory failure.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Risk of pressure ulcers within 72 hours from noninvasive ventilation beginning.
primary_outcome.description: Skin lesions were classified as follows: reddening, loss of skin integrity, necrotic lesion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of skin pressure ulcers in patients treated with noninvasive ventilation.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Incidence of skin pressure ulcers. Patients will be followed during duration of high dependency unit stay for an average length of stay of 7 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Characterization of skin lesions during noninvasive ventilation in patients with acute respiratory failure.

arm_group.description: Patients treated with noninvasive ventilation for an episode of acute respiratory failure

study_pop.textblock: Patients admitted to our high dependency unit for an episode of acute respiratory failure and treated with noninvasive ventilation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- severe dyspnea at rest
- respiratory rate > 30 per minute
- PaO2/FiO2 < 200 (despite oxygen with Venturi with a FiO2 og 0.5)
- use of accessory respiratory muscles
- pH < 7.35 > 7.10
Exclusion Criteria:
- STEMI
- NSTEMI/Unstable angina
- Hemodynamic instability
- Need for immediate endotracheal intubation
- Inability to protect the airways
- Impaired sensorium
- Pulmonary embolism
- Gastrointestinal bleeding
- Hematological malignancy or neoplasms with ECOG performance status > 2
